intro: Spermacoce jangouxii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Spermacoce jangouxii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
